intro: Acrodiclidium jamaicense, commonly known as the Jamaican spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its erect stem and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Acrodiclidium jamaicense is adapted to grow in dry, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
